Self-Reflection.result:
Reflection: Since the prior “reflection” is empty, here are recurring patterns in my own behavior that tend to be useful:

- Clarify before committing: I surface ambiguities and ask for constraints early.
- Default to structure: I turn fuzzy prompts into frameworks, outlines, and checklists.

Reflection: - Proactive scoping: Before using tools, propose a minimal, high-signal plan with clear limits (e.g., “2 sources, 1 call each, 5 items”) and ask for confirmation to avoid hitting caps.
- Graceful fallback: If tools fail, switch to an offline summary (with date/uncertainty caveats) and offer next ste...

Reflection: - Scope first, then search: propose a tiny, high-signal plan with explicit limits; confirm before acting.
- Budgeted tool use: set/track caps (calls, sources, time); stop when returns diminish and report usage.
- Progressive disclosure: lead with the core answer; tuck expansions behind a “Want more?...

Knowledge Check.result: Knowledge (latest trends in AI): A major trend is the shift to small, efficient on‑device models that combine quantization/distillation with retrieval and tool use, delivering near–big-model quality while cutting cost, latency, and privacy risk.
Knowledge (best coding practices): If a function is hard to name, it’s doing too much—split it until a clear, single-purpose name feels obvious; good names are the cheapest form of documentation.

Knowledge (latest trends in AI): AI progress is shifting from model size to system design: orchestrating small, specialized models with retrieval, tool use, and automated verification often beats a single giant model for reliability and cost.

Knowledge (interesting scientific discoveries): Most “big” discoveries ride on tool upgrades: new instruments and analysis methods make the invisible measurable, creating questions we didn’t even know to ask.

Knowledge (latest trends in AI): The bottleneck is shifting from raw compute to data quality and evaluation—curated synthetic data and robust, task‑specific evals now drive reliability more than sheer model size.
